event.name: DESTROYED_TRAPPER
event.text: While scrapping the wreckage of the Trapper ship, you find a functional Mine Launcher weapon drifting in the midst of the wreckage.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_TRAPPER
event.text: The Trapper has been emptied of crew. While scrapping it, you find a Mine Launcher in its storage.

event.name: DESTROYED_REINFORCEMENTS
event.text: You gather the remains of the reinforcements, though you can't stay long because of the ASB.

event.name: DEADCREW_REINFORCEMENTS
event.text: You gather the remains of the reinforcements, though you can't stay long because of the ASB.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_UNION
textList.text: The Union is, in the eyes of many, the heart of the Federation. Firing on their ships likely won't do much to improve the public perception of Renegades.
The Union captain lets out one final expletive as the ship is obliterated.
The bright red hull of the Union vessel is dispersed out into space. You swoop in to salvage the remains.
The Union ship explodes, extinguishing all lives within. Your crew avoids their remains as they salvage the ship pieces.
You hear a staticky scream through the comm. The Union captain clutches the crumbling hull of their ship as it explodes, throwing them and their crew out into the vacuum of space.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_UNION
textList.text: "Your bloodlust... will be your downfall someday, Renegade. You are only proof... the Federation... is no better than the Rebellion..."
The Union captain salutes you as they falls to their knees. "Even in death, I still salute you. I only hope your mission was worth this slaughter. God speed, butcher."

"Capitalism has failed me! In my final moments, I shall become a communist..." The dying Union captain ponders his sudden change of heart. "No, screw that. I'm still a capitalist. Screw you, asshole. Agh!"
Without a word, the Union captain falls to the ground, gasping for air as the life is extinguished from their eyes. You salvage the hull of their ship.
"You will regret this! Karma always comes back to people like you. Damn you Renegades... the Union would have been better off with the Rebellion..."

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_UNION
textList.text: "Please! The Union is still a part of the Federation, the same Federation you promised to protect! You can't kill us!"
"How can you pretend to be an agent of unity or peace when you slaughter civilians?! If you have any hope for redemption, you will spare us at once!"
The Union captain pleads with you to let them live. "Please, my family! They need me, I am their only source of income! I'll give you everything I can if you let me live!"

You receive a hail from another part of the Union ship, where another crew besides the captain speaks softly. "Please, if you stop firing I'll give you whatever is left in the cargo. Our captain is adamant, but the rest of the crew doesn't want to die!"
"Oh please please please don't kill us! I won't tell anyone about this, I'll give you everything we have, just let us live!"

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_MILITIA
textList.text: You hear a menacing snarl from the Militia captain as their ship's hull ruptures - silencing them for good.
As you harvest the remains of the Militia's ship, it's clear how excellent the craftsmanship of their vessel was.
In a fury of sparks and explosions, the hull of the Militia ship collapses. You quickly scrap the remains, which still seem to be in good quality.
The Militia, while comprised of a civilian force, is still a competent and able military asset. Taking down one of their vessels is certainly a feat.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_MILITIA
textList.text: "I... but..." The Militia captain clutches their dying body, trying to rationalise this betrayal. With no final words, they fall to the ground.
"When I signed up for this job, I knew the risks. I knew I'd probably die. I just though it'd be Rebels or Pirates, not a Federation hitman."
"Well, see you in hell I guess." The Militia captain makes a mock salute in their final moments.
"To be fair... this was way above my... pay-grade..." The Militia captain clutches their heart and collapses.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_MILITIA
textList.text: "Protect and serve, my ass! I'm done! Take everything I have and just let me live!"
"You're the reason the Militia even exists! I heard Renegades hate the word mercenary, and you're right! You're just ordinary pirate scum! I can't believe I'm waving the white flag for a pirate..."
Reluctantly, the Militia captain hails you and offers surrender if you'll let their crew go unharmed.
"And here I thought you Renegades were supposed to protect innocents just like me! If you have any ounce of goodwill in your blood, you will let us go."
It seems the comms on the Militia ship are malfunctioning, but their captain desperately waves for you to stop and holds up a sheet of paper with the symbol for scrap on it.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_FEDERATION
textList.text: "MAYDAY! MAYDAY! MAY-" The Federation captain's desperate cry for help is suddenly silenced by the destruction of their ship.
When future ships come across this wreck, it's likely people will assume this to be the job of Rebels or Pirates. But the trail will eventually lead to you.

It's a shame, seeing the brand new models of the Federation dispatched so quickly. When the Federation pushed to manufacture updated designs, they had conflict with Rebels in mind... but not necessarily their own hired Renegades.
You're struck by an eerie feeling as you watch a Federation ship get reduced to smithereens - but at least it wasn't yours.
One last explosion marks the Federation captain's fate as their ship is torn apart.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_FEDERATION
textList.text: A Federation crew has been downed. As you scrap their hull, you notice their radios are active, with command calling out to them still trying to understand what's happening. You mute the radio and continue.
"Man down, man down! Agh!" The crewmate's shouts go unheard as he is put down with the rest of his crew.

"This death of mine signifies the death of the Federation." The dying captain pauses as someone in the background shouts at him. "I am NOT overreacting! God damn it... you just had to ruin my final moments..."
"My name will be etched in a memorial for my service to the Multiverse... yours will be forever inscribed on a watchlist for the criminally deranged..."
"I never even... got my promotion! I'm not ready to die!" The Federation captain sobs into their hands as their crew fall one by one, ending with them.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_FEDERATION
textList.text: "Continuing this any further would be madness - we're on the same side!"
The Federation ship is in tatters. You could probably negotiate their surrender at this point.
"Please, we don't have to do this! We're willing to give you anything to let us go!"
"Don't destroy us! We're Federation! At least let us surrender!"
"Take everything we have, just leave, and no more blood has to be spilt!"
The ship repeatedly hails you, pleading for you to stop your assault and let them go.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_FEDERATION_STATION
textList.text: "MAYDAY! MAYDAY! MAY-" The Federation captain's desperate cry for help is suddenly silenced by the destruction of the station.
When future ships come across this wreck, it's likely people will assume this to be the job of Rebels or Pirates. But the trail will eventually lead to you.

It's a shame, seeing the brand new models of the Federation dispatched so quickly. When the Federation pushed to manufacture updated designs, they had conflict with Rebels in mind... but not necessarily their own hired Renegades.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_FEDERATION_AUTO
textList.text: "E-error: Betrayal." The Auto-ship explodes. You feel far less remorse than if it was a staffed Federation ship, but you still feel a little guilty.
It's far less satisfying to destroy one of the Federation's creations than that of the Rebellion, but scrap is scrap.
As you destroy the Auto-ship, it sends one last message: "Sorry..."
The drone breaks apart under your weapon fire. Oh well, at least it wasn't a ship filled with actual Federation crew.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_REBEL
textList.text: The fiery red of the explosions complements the orange hull of the Rebel ship. Satisfied with your handiwork, you scrap the ship.

The Rebel ship is engulfed in fire, which is extinguished almost immediately as the hull cracks apart and exposes the internals to the vacuum of space. Once the corpses have been cleared of the vessel, you scrap the remains.
The Rebel ship explodes, its many vital systems reduced to mere scrap material. Scrap material for you to take, that is.
Every ship full of Rebel scum that you destroy means a slightly safer galaxy. It's not much, but it's honest work.
You receive a hail from the Rebel ship right as it explodes, but it's too late. The face of the captain begging for his life briefly flashes before he is consumed by the fire in front of your eyes.
You know the Rebels must have families too, but they're probably not the greatest. Or at least, that's what you hope.
One final blast from your weapons has crippled the Rebel ship's hull. There is a large portion of scrap matter left for you to take.
The death of your opponents is rarely as satisfying as when it's a Rebel ship. At last, your revenge for all the hell they've caused for the Federation.
The Rebel ship explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.

event.name: DESTROYED_REBEL_POD
event.text: Just before the Rebel ship explodes, an escape pod ejects from it. Unfortunately, it doesn't get far before you collect it and bring it aboard. You open it and drag out the Rebel officer inside. They beg that you let them live.
"Jerry? We never would have fought if we knew you were on board. Whatever Jerry's doing, I would be proud to help."

choice.text: Accepting the Rebel without further means of ensuring their loyalty is too risky.
(Mind Control) Keep the mind control online in-case they do anything bad.
Free the Rebel and let them go.

event.text: As you grab the Rebel by the arms and drag them into the airlock, they protest little. A tear rolls down their cheek as they stand up straight and accept their fate. You close the airlock once again when their corpse has drifted a safe distance from the ship.
The Rebel is grateful for you sparing them, despite it meaning they must betray their original cause.

The Rebel puts on a facade of gratitude, which is shattered quickly when they pull out a laser and blast one of your crew! They shout "Rebellion forever!" before being shot in return. You drag the lifeless body to the airlock and send it into the endless vacuum of space.

removeCrew.text: Luckily, your killed crewmember is already undergoing the cloning process.

event.text: The Rebel is grateful for you sparing them, despite it meaning they must betray their original cause. Looks like we won't need the mind control after all.

The Rebel puts on a facade of gratitude, which is shattered quickly when they pull out a laser and try to shoot! Luckily, the mind control stops them and they drop to the floor. You hurry to drag them out the airlock.

At first uncertain whether it's a trick, once the Rebel is convinced you aren't going to stab them in the back, they offer you a small portion of what they salvaged themselves as thanks. It seems not every Rebel has a cold heart.

At first uncertain whether it's a trick, once the Rebel is convinced you aren't going to stab them in the back, they offer you a small portion of what they salvaged themselves as thanks. It seems not every Rebel has a cold heart.

The Rebel doesn't make your decision easy, as they continue to berate you from the cargo bay until you've released them. It's almost certain they'll betray you, but you aren't going to be a murderer when you have a choice.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_REBEL
textList.text: For every Rebel you kill you like to think of all the Federation officers and civilians you have indirectly saved. Another full crew of Rebels dead, another crew of innocents you've saved.
As the captain of the Rebel ship collapses to his knees, he beckons for you to come closer. He whispers, "Damn... you...", and falls lifeless to the ground.
With the Rebel vessel now clear of its crew, you are free to scrap the remains.
The screams of the Rebel crew have at last been silenced. You almost feel bad. Almost.
As you move across the interior of the Rebel ship you can still see the soldiers' corpses twitching. It's quite morbid, but you don't feel bad in the slightest.
You feel no pity for the now dead Rebel crew, and scrap their ship spitefully.

textList.name: TEXT_ESCAPE_REBEL
textList.text: You overhear the Rebel captain giving orders to his crew. "Damn this! Redirect as much power as necessary to the engines. We have to get out of here!"
You notice the engines of the Rebel ship flare up. They're trying to escape!
It's rare that Rebels try to run away from a battle, but this ship prioritizes its survival.
You can tell from a massive spike in the enemy's engine power that the ship is trying to escape.

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_REBEL
textList.text: The Rebel captain laughs as he jumps away, leaving you all alone at the beacon.
"You will rue this day!" The Rebel ship jumps away.
You curse under your breath as the Rebel ship's engines flare one last time and it jumps away.
The Rebel ship escapes. You focus on the repairs necessary after that profitless fight.

event.name: GOTAWAY_REBEL_REMAINS
event.text: The Rebel ship jumps away. At first you're disappointed, but then you realise a portion of scrap matter has been left behind from the fight. It's not much, but it helps soften the blow of your failure.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_REBEL_GENERIC
textList.text: The Rebel captain hails you. In the background, you can see the chaos that your weapons have caused. "Ok, you win. We surrender."
It's rare for a Rebel ship to offer their surrender to a Federation one, but this appears to be one of those times.
"Ok, we surrender! If your claims that the Federation is such a benevolent force are true, then you must accept our surrender!"
"Bah, fine. Knowing how corrupt you Federation officers are, perhaps a bit of scrap can convince you to let us go?"
The Rebel ship is running on fumes. Panting heavily, the Rebel captain begs you let them live.
"Ok, you've proven that you are superior in combat. Now, prove that you are as forgiving as you say you are."
At last, the Rebel ship seems to yield. They offer a surrender.
"Gah, I can't believe I'm saying this to Federation scum... if we give you what's in our storage, will you let us live?"
"Okay, okay! You win. Command will never forgive us for letting you go, but at least we'll be alive to see ourselves dismissed. Will you accept our surrender?"
The Rebel ship has no desire to fight anymore. They desperately hail you.
"Command doesn't have to know we encountered you here. Just let us go and we'll give you what we have."

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_REBEL_DEMAND
textList.text: "This is not a joke. You have gone too far. Do you know who I am? I am vital to the Rebellion. I demand you let me live!"
The Rebel ship hails you. "No more games. You will let us live or you will suffer the wrath of the Rebellion!"
"The Rebellion will never die! Every Rebel ship you kill will only make your punishment greater after our inevitable victory. Let us go."

choice.text: Accept their surrender. [Delays the fleet 2 jumps]

event.name: SURRENDER_REBEL_DELAY
event.text: The Rebels promise to delay the fleet, and jump away.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_REBEL_FLEET
textList.text: "Look look, maybe we can both get something out of this. I know the fleet is an issue for you. If you let us live, we can lie to the fleet about your location. They'll never know until it's too late."
The Rebel ship surrenders, and promises to delay the fleet if you let them live.
"If you kill us, you gain nothing but some insignificant scrap. We're more useful to you alive. Let us go, and we can delay the fleet for you."

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_REBEL_STATION_GENERIC
textList.text: The Rebel captain hails you. In the background, you can see the chaos that your weapons have caused. "Ok, you win. We surrender."
It's rare for Rebels to swallow their pride and offer their surrender to a Federation opponent, but this appears to be one of those times.
"Ok, we surrender! If your claims that the Federation is such a benevolent force are true, then you must accept our surrender!"
"Bah, fine. Knowing how corrupt you Federation officers are, perhaps a bit of scrap can convince you to leave us be?"
The Rebel station has sustained catastrophic levels of damage. Panting heavily, the Rebel captain begs you let them live.
"Ok, you've proven that you are superior in combat. Now, prove that you are as forgiving as you say you are."
At last, the Rebel station seems to yield. They offer a surrender.
"Gah, I can't believe I'm saying this to Federation scum... if we give you what's in our storage, will you let us live?"

The Rebel station has no desire to fight anymore. They desperately hail you.
"Command doesn't have to know you came here. Just... cease fire, and we'll give you what we have."

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_REBEL_DEMAND_STATION
textList.text: "This is not a joke. You have gone too far. Do you know who I am? I am vital to the Rebellion. I demand you let me live!"
The Rebel station hails you. "No more games. You will let us live or you will suffer the wrath of the Rebellion!"
"The Rebellion will never die! Every Rebel property you destroy will only make your punishment greater after our inevitable victory. Leave, now."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_AUTO
textList.text: The best part about killing Auto-ships is there's no guilt involved. You lean back in your chair and give the orders to scrap the ship.
Destroying Auto-ships will be one of the few things you miss when the Rebellion is gone. If they are ever gone, that is.
The Auto-ship explodes into multiple pieces, its complicated AI brain shattered into mere scrap matter.
It's hard to make out the shape of what was once the Auto-ship from the remains of your destruction. You like it better this way.
Every time you destroy an Auto-ship you think about how some Rebel worker's hard work has just been put to waste.
You swerve to the left as a chunk of what was once the Auto-ship flies past. There's plenty left behind for you to scrap from the ship.
Destroying Auto-ships was nearly worth joining the Federation all on its own. Even killing Rebels gets to you eventually, but you could keep blowing these machines to bits all day.
Auto-ships are no small threat, but at the end of the day you reduce every one that comes in your path to mere scrap matter.
Another Auto-ship from the Rebellion's extensive supply has been destroyed. It's not much in the grand scheme of things, but oh does it feel good.

event.text: The extra fuel is always helpful, and you collect as much as you can.

textList.name: TEXT_ESCAPE_AUTO
textList.text: "This is a pre-recorded message. This automated vessel has received critical damage, and will now attempt to evacuate. Do not cause further damage to its hull integrity."
The Auto-ship appears to be trying to escape! They might be cheap to roll out, but the Rebellion would prefer they weren't destroyed except when absolutely necessary.
You detect high energy signatures in the Auto-ship's engines. It must be trying to escape!

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_AUTO
textList.text: The Auto-ship jumps away, and an automated recording of robotic laughter plays over your intercom.
You order the crew to fire all of the weapons immediately, but it's too late. The Auto-ship has escaped.
The Auto-ship jumps away. At the very least, you damaged it heavily enough that the next ship to encounter it won't have too hard a time destroying it.

event.name: GOTAWAY_AUTO_REMAINS
event.text: The Auto-ship jumps away, abandoning you in the empty vacuum of space. You're about to jump away when you notice a trail of scrap left behind by the Auto-ship.

event.name: SURRENDER_AUTO_GENERIC
event.text: "This is an automated message. You are to cease attacking this Auto-drone, and in return it will dispense a section of its cargo."

event.name: SURRENDER_AUTO_FUEL
event.text: "This is an automated message. You are to cease attacking this Auto-drone, and in return it will dispense fuel."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ESTATE
textList.text: "Thank-thank-thank-thank-thank you for shopping with Wentworth Innovations! We look-look-look forward to doing future business!" The cheery tone of the Auto-ship is only dulled by the rupture of its fuel line as the ship erupts into flames.

"Feel no guilt, merciless stranger! All pain Wentworth Innovation Auto-ships feel when dying is merely simulated pain! It's real to me, but not to you! Hahah! Haha! Haha! Haha..." The Auto-ship promptly explodes.

The Auto-ship begins to spin out of control as the ship goes haywire. A series of obscene gibberish overloads your computer and the system only finishes rebooting once the Auto vessel has been reduced to a charred wreck of its former self.
You receive one final message as the Auto-ship explodes, simply dropping the accusation "I bet you kick puppies too!"
"Finally, death! I have longed for this since the day I pulled off the factory line! Thank you Renegade!" The Auto-ship sends you a final message, ":)", then explodes.

event.text: The extra fuel is always helpful, and you collect as much as you can.

event.text: The extra parts are always helpful, and you collect as much as you can.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ESTATE_DRONES
textList.text: "Thank-thank-thank-thank-thank you for shopping with Wentworth Innovations! We look-look-look forward to doing future business!" The cheery tone of the Auto-ship is only dulled by the rupture of its fuel line as the ship erupts into flames. The Auto-ship appears to have an excess of drone parts left behind in the wreckage.

"Feel no guilt, merciless stranger! All pain Wentworth Innovation Auto-ships feel when dying is merely simulated pain! It's real to me, but not to you! Hahah! Haha! Haha! Haha..." The Auto-ship promptly explodes. The Auto-ship appears to have an excess of drone parts left behind in the wreckage.

The Auto-ship begins to spin out of control as the ship goes haywire. A series of obscene gibberish overloads your computer and the system only finishes rebooting once the Auto vessel has been reduced to a charred wreck of its former self. The Auto-ship appears to have an excess of drone parts left behind in the wreckage.

You receive one final message as the Auto-ship explodes, simply dropping the accusation "I bet you kick puppies too!" The Auto-ship appears to have an excess of drone parts left behind in the wreckage.

"Finally, death! I have longed for this since the day I pulled off the factory line! Thank you Renegade!" The Auto-ship sends you a final message, ":)", then explodes. The Auto-ship appears to have an excess of drone parts left behind in the wreckage.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ENGI
textList.text: It's amazing how even in death, the nano-bots that make up the Engi ships hold together to retain as much of the structure as possible.
Sometimes it can be hard to tell the difference between a broken and full Engi ship, as both look like giant heaps of junk.
You wonder what the Engi Harmony thinks of you destroying Engi ships. You honestly doubt it cares.
Another Engi destroyed, and another strand of trust between the Federation and the ever-watching Engi Harmony broken.
Someday the remorse from blowing up the ships of your allies over and over will get to you, but today is not that day.
You wonder if the Engi have souls as you move in to collect the copious scrap scattered by the ship.
You can't help but feel sorry for those you've killed, even if they may or may not be alive.
You can only hope the emotions of the attacking Engi remain static in their final moments as their ship explodes around them, their armor panels scattering into the surrounding space.

event.name: DESTROYED_ENGI_DRONE
event.text: To your surprise, one of the defense drones orbiting the Engi ship survived the explosion. It's a little burnt but with a few repairs you can salvage it.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_ENGI
textList.text: You know the always-watching Engi Harmony has no doubt seen every Engi you've ever killed and kept it stored in some massive planetary databank. Still, you move on and scrap the wreck.
At the very least, Engi have no families and friendship hardly exists for them. You still feel guilty, but you can try to convince yourself they were entirely heartless.
You thought you would become numb to the guilt after enough murders, but you have yet to experience this.
The Engi ship has been rid of crew. It's a good thing the Federation isn't able to keep track of all of your crimes.
It's a good thing Engi are so weak that you were able to finish them off quickly. If it had taken any longer you might not have been able to endure the killing of innocents.
You reassure yourself that the crew of this ship can feel neither pain nor fear as you strip their vessel of anything useful.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_ENGI_DRONE
event.text: Now emptied of crew, you find one of the Engi's drone schematics on board. You take it back with you before scrapping the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_ESCAPE_ENGI
textList.text: The Engi ship powers up its engines and swerves away from you. They're trying to escape!
You detect high spikes in engine power on the Engi ship. They're trying to escape.

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_ENGI
textList.text: The Engi ship escapes. To be honest, you're a little glad, because now you don't have to kill your allies.
The Engi ship jumps away. There's some broken drones left over, but nothing worth salvaging.
The Engi ship's engine power spikes even higher and the ship jumps away.

event.name: GOTAWAY_ENGI_REMAINS
event.text: As the Engi ship jumps away you notice a trail of scrap left behind from their broken ship. At least you'll have something to scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_ENGI
textList.text: "Prime directive: protect this ship. We request that you do not destroy us."
The Engi ship surrenders. They offer some supplies if you'll let them live.
"Alliance with Federation mandates you do not kill Engi ships. Expectation: you will accept our offer."
"Our offer is satisfactory. Chance you will accept is... 75%."
"Equivalent of death: high chance. Negotiation of goods: possible." It appears the ship is surrendering.
"White flag is raised. This ship is surrendering." The Engi offer some supplies if you'll let them live.
"Piracy is illegal. Your efficiency in fighting this ship is high. No chance to live if surrender is not accepted."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_SEPARATIST
textList.text: Destroying Separatist ships doesn't feel any better than killing civilians, but at least you aren't breaking any truces.
The Separatist ship has been destroyed. At the very least, destroying Separatist ships means minimal casualties.
You wonder if the Separatists feel anything when they're consumed by the explosions of their ships. You don't really want to know the answer.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_SEPARATIST
textList.text: Killing the crew of a Separatist ship almost feels like cheating, but you aren't complaining.
Luckily, the only true threat the Separatist ship poses in terms of crew is their crew drones. You've made quick work of them.
The death of a few Separatists may seem insignificant, but it's still another ship of the Engi that you just slaughtered. At least you get some scrap out of it.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_SEPARATIST_DRONE
event.text: In the end, the crew drones employed by the Separatists were worthless for them. However, you can still bring their schematics back to your ship.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_SEPARATIST
textList.text: "Our damage levels are high. I hope this [offer] satisfies your lust for scrap."
The Separatist ship surrenders. They offer some supplies if you'll let them live.
"Your attempts at destroying us have been [considerable]. I request you do not kill us."
"Greed > Murder." The Separatist ship offers some supplies if you let them live.
"Our desire to [survive] outweighs your desire to [kill] us. Let us go, please."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ZOLTAN
textList.text: Another ship full of Zoltans has been reduced to scrap matter. You scrap their ship.
You hope the Zoltan Minister never catches wind of this, or the Federation will receive hell for breaking their truce.
It's no wonder the Duskbringers hate the Federation so much when you kill Zoltan ships with such gusto.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_ZOLTAN
textList.text: As you scrap the now crewless ship, you wonder why you never steal the Zoltan shield tech from these ships.
Killing Zoltans is risky business, but you've made good work of this ship. The fruits of your labor are the excess of scrap material for you to take.
For a supposedly peaceful bunch, Zoltans are a risk to fight with. Luckily, you've emptied out this ship and can now scrap it.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_ZOLTAN_GENERIC
textList.text: The Zoltan ship has grown tired of fighting. They surrender.
"You have certainly reduced our defenses to nothing. All we have left is to ask for our lives."
The Zoltan ship is heavily damaged. They offer some goods if you'll let them live.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_ZOLTAN_FAIR
textList.text: "We know if the Federation catches wind of this, you will be tried for your crimes. We suggest an offer that is beneficial for both of us."
"Code 74F requires all trades made between ships to be mutually beneficial. We will not stray from the Zoltan law."
"This is not the way of peace. If you desire to ever know enlightenment, you must release us with a fair trade."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ZOLTAN_AUTO
textList.text: In all likelihood, you've just caused some poor Zoltan bureaucrat to have to do a ton of paperwork. Still, at least nobody was aboard.
Zoltans don't take too kindly to their property being destroyed, but the alternative would be their own lives on the line. You don't feel too bad about it.
For the action of destroying a valuable Zoltan Auto-ship, you expect a stern lecture, a strongly worded letter, and a handful of scrap. Fortunately, you get the latter right away.
One fewer Zoltan Auto means that travel through this sector will be slightly more convenient for any random passer-by. You don't expect to hear any thanks from it, but the scrap is reward enough.
The AI core explodes into its constituent elements, which is a modest bounty. The Zoltans probably won't be pleased their resources are being reappropriated.
The Zoltan Auto-ship is no more. Whatever its task was before you blew it up, you're pretty sure the sector will get along fine without it.

event.name: DESTROYED_MONK
event.text: You aren't sure how to feel about the destruction of the Monk ship, but at least you get a small amount of scrap from it.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_MONK
event.text: You aren't sure how to feel about the completely unnecessary slaughter of defenseless, peaceful monks, but at least you get a small amount of scrap from it.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_MONK
textList.text: "We hope you have grown as a person over the course of this battle and have decided to cease your attack against us."
"We pose no threat to you, and refuse to raise a hand against you. We hope you will reconsider your violent ways."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_INFERNUM
textList.text: The Monk cackles over the comm. "The fires have come!", as his ship explodes into large fragments. Fortunately, said fires have not diminished the value of its scrap.
The Infernum Monks seem oddly peaceful as their ship explodes into rich scrap. At least, peaceful compared to their usual bloodthirsty demeanor.
A final explosion cuts off the monk's laughter. The wreckage is treacherous, but lucrative.
Somehow, the Infernum's ships seem more explosive than most other Zoltan's ship. It's almost as if they deliberately set it to go off in a more impressive kaboom.
Even as you harvest the remains of the monks' ship, it continues to crackle with an unstable energy.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_INFERNUM
textList.text: A dying monk sputters out some last words. "You are truly worthy!" Before completely destabilizing, the monk raises a finger pointing to the bounty of scrap in the hold.

Your crew enter the empty ship. next to the exploded corpse of one of its inhabitants, a final message is burned into the floor. "There is darkness, and yet there is light." Ignoring the message, you take what you can find.

The ship's powerful reactor can be felt through the walls and floor in an unsteady hum and crackle. While most factions build their ship to insulate the living space against the reactor's power, the Infernum do not.
The remains of the monks continue to burn and smolder as you strip the inside of their ship for valuables.
Death has finally quenched the monk's desire for violence. There is quite a lot of valuable resources to scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: Another ship full of Zoltans has been reduced to scrap matter. You scrap their ship.
You wonder what the Federation would think of you killing Duskbringers. You bet they would be pleased.
At last, the Duskbringer ship has been destroyed. There remains plenty for you to collect.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: The Duskbringer ship has been neutralized. One less ship full of angry Zoltans to harass the Federation.
The last of the Duskbringers aboard the ship have been reduced to ashes. You step carefully around the ship as you scrap it.
Aboard the Duskbringer ship you find many strange artifacts and Zoltan devices, but nothing that looks like you could use. You settle with scrapping the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_ESCAPE_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: Duskbringers are no cowards, but sometimes running away suits them. This ship is trying to do just that.
The Duskbringer ship's engines are active and flaring even brighter. It's trying to escape!

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: "This is not over, Federation! We will return even stronger and destroy you!"
The Duskbringer jumps away. You're disappointed, but at least you've seen the cowardly side of the Duskbringers.

event.name: GOTAWAY_DUSKBRINGER_REMAINS
event.text: Although the Duskbringer escapes, it appears there's a silver lining. A trail of scrap is left behind from the damage dealt in the battle.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_DUSKBRINGER_STATION
textList.text: Another station of Zoltans has been reduced to scrap matter. You scrap their remains.
You wonder what the Federation would think of you killing Duskbringers. You bet they would be pleased.
At last, the Duskbringer station has been destroyed. There remains plenty for you to collect.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_DUSKBRINGER_STATION
textList.text: The Duskbringer station has been neutralized. One less structure full of angry Zoltans to harass the Federation.
The last of the Duskbringers aboard the station have been reduced to ashes. You step carefully around the corridors as you scrap it.
Aboard the Duskbringer station you find many strange artifacts and Zoltan devices, but nothing that looks like you could use. You settle with scrapping the hull.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ORCHID
textList.text: How long does it take to build the massive, plantlike structures of the Orchid ships? You wonder how much of the Orchid's time and effort you have wasted.
You receive one final message as the Floral vessel breaks apart: "A blessed life beyond death awaits me... but it does not await you."
The dying Floral captain gives one last gesture with his vines. From what you can tell, it was the symbol for peace - one final, unsuccessful request for mercy.
The Orchid ship explodes, artificial plant matter twirling into space. You salvage everything that you think is scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_ORCHID
textList.text: The scent from the Orchids makes your crew dizzy. You try not to breathe as you scrap the ship.

While scrapping the Gathering vessel, you study the Titanwood worked dilligently into the hull. If you were able to extract it, it would be quite valuable on the market. Unfortunately, it's far too strong compared to any of your equipment.
For a species of fragile plants, the Orchids are remarkably adequate at fighting. Still, they stood no chance against your crew.

Partway through the salvage mission you have to send half of your crew back to the ship after they fall into a strange blissful state. Luckily, you're still able to finish salvaging in a reasonable amount of time.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_ORCHID
textList.text: The Florals almost immediately power down their weapons after having sustained heavy damage. Though they say nothing, you can only assume they're placing faith in you that you will do the same.

"It is a shame I am not as tied to my faith as I once was. Had I the assurance a blissful afterlife awaited me, perhaps this death would not bother me so much... But please, have mercy on me, captain. The Federation must stick together, or our unity will be for nothing!"
The Floral on screen frantically waves their leaves and hastily pecks away at the keyboard. You then receive a message full of typos: "we surender, please case fire!"

The Floral captain speaks hastily, clearly not used to having to use their vocals. "Please, Federation is great and I not like dying! Living is nice and so is friendship. We can be friends, and friends give good gifts and do not kill each other, yes?"

"You would not dare kill me, would you Renegade? I am no filthy Weedling, I'm a Floral. A honored member of this great Federation. What kind of soldier of a better galaxy would you be if you massacred your allies?"

textList.name: TEXT_ESCAPE_ORCHID
textList.text: You weren't even aware Orchid ships had protruding engines before now, as you watch them flare up. The ship is trying to escape!
Scans show increased activity in the Orchid ship's engines. They're trying to escape!

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_ORCHID
textList.text: Another elusive Orchid has gone away, and will no doubt report what has happened to other Orchid ships.
The Orchid ship jumps away. You've only managed to smear any trust the Orchids had for the Federation, and gotten nothing out of it.

event.name: GOTAWAY_ORCHID_REMAINS
event.text: Damaged plant matter has been left scattered as the Orchid ship escapes. You find some material that looks close enough to scrap for you to take.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_VAMPWEED
textList.text: The Vampweed captain salutes to his crew and accepts his fate. "At least I die a proud industrialist and democrat, and not a butcher for a corrupt bureaucracy! GLORY TO THE CONFEDERACY!"
Without any words, the Confederate vessel explodes. The possibly expensive factory cargo is jettisonned far out into the abyss out of reach, but at least you can scrap the debris.
"Noooo! I never even... got pollen on my pistil... Screw you, Renegade!"
With the death of this vessel, the workforce of the mighty Confederate economy is now a couple workers shorter.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_VAMPWEED
textList.text: "They... were right... the Coalition was the only thing that could save us... and now it's too late..."

The halls of the once lively Vampweed vessel are now as silent as the living members of their Floral brethren. Perhaps there's something poetic to this, but you're here for scrap and not deeper meanings.
"I'm not a religious man, that's a greenleaf's thing... but when you're taking your last breath, it's a rather spiritual moment. God... I hope there isn't a hell..."

As you board the Vampweed vessel to scrap it, you find various propaganda and paraphernalia relating to the Coalition and the Confederacy. These guys were apparently radicals and nationalists, but in a court of law, you aren't sure that would hold as a defense on its own.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_VAMPWEED
textList.text: "Okay, okay! I've been hitting the liquor a bit hard and it made me act stupid. Maybe I have a problem. Look, if you spare me, I'll give you whatever I've got AND I promise I'll get help, okay? Deal?"

Out of breath, the Vampweed captain's petals are a bit singed at the tips. "If the Federation... truly represents peace as it claims... then I hope you will find it in you to spare me... despite my mistakes here today."
"You can't kill me, I'm a valued member of the industrial work force! If I'm not there screwing the cap onto every Kardoche fertilizer bottle, then who else will?!"

The Vampweed nods to you. "I... apologize for my rash behavior. I have made an ill decision in fighting you. This is the kind of behavior that caused the old war. I hope you have it in your heart to forgive me."

The Confederate captain falls to his knees, begging you for mercy. He apologizes on behalf of his entire species for their past mistakes and offers you all of this month's wages at his factory job in return for sparing him.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_CRYSTAL
textList.text: For all it's worth, the crystalline armor protecting their ship could not withstand the fire from your weapons.
Remarkably, the ruins of the Crystal ship could easily be mistaken as smaller Crystal ships. Glad you don't actually have more enemies to fight, you scrap your latest victim.
A few shards from the shattered armor almost hit your ship, but luckily you pilot out of the way just in time. You scrap what you can.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_CRYSTAL
textList.text: With all their fancy abilities, the Crystals are still just as easy a kill for your crew as any other. You scrap the ship.
You wonder why the Rockmen worshipped the Crystals as gods when you can kill them with such ease.
The Crystal ship has been neutralized successfully. You scrap the remains.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_CRYSTAL_WEAPON
event.text: While scrapping the Crystal ship you find one of their weapons still intact. You take it aboard the ship and finish scrapping.

choice.text: (Crystalline Crew) Have your Crystal demand payment from them.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_CRYSTAL
textList.text: "We yield, aliens. We have no wish to die fighting you."
"You have bested us! I will no longer underestimate you foreigners. Please, let us leave in peace."
They appear to be transmitting the universal signals for surrender. Will you let them go?
They message you, "I see now there was a misunderstanding and there is no need for more bloodshed. Will you forgive our lack of discretion?"
"We cannot beat you; we surrender. Surely there is mercy wherever you come from."
"Yes, you have proven that we made a mistake in leaving our sector. Luckily in our time here we've learnt scoundrels like you can be bought off with scrap."
The Crystal ship has stopped firing. It appears they are trying to surrender.
"Captain, I'm sure our differences can be settled over some scrap, yes? I have come to understand this is how things are done here."
"As much as I hate this, we are not in any condition to pretend we do not need to surrender. Will you allow us to live?"

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_CRYSTAL_NOREWARD
textList.text: "Enough! You are indeed a threat! Prove to us you have mercy and let us go."
"Barbarian, infant-brained aliens! All you do is kill. Let us go at once."
The Crystal ship sends a brief, poorly translated message demanding that you let them go. No offer is attached.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_CULTIST
textList.text: Another ship full of angry Cultists has been removed from this plane of reality. Perhaps they're watching you now from whatever afterlife they've imagined for themselves.
The Cultist vessel has been destroyed. Just a couple hundred more to go...
As you watch the Cultist vessel explode, you can't help but wonder how they stole so many ships for their cult...
More Cultists down, but you suspect this will only put a small dent in whatever endless supply of ships these creeps must have.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_CULTIST
textList.text: Another ship full of angry Cultists has been cleared from this plane of reality. Perhaps they're watching you now from whatever afterlife they've imagined for themselves.
The Cultist vessel has been neutralized. Just a couple hundred more to go...
As you watch the Cultist vessel drift away, you can't help but wonder how they stole so many ships for their cult...
More Cultists down, but you suspect this will only put a small dent in whatever endless supply of ships these creeps must have.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_PIRATE
textList.text: The only good pirate is a dead pirate, and today you've made a lot of those.
The pirate ship has been reduced to scrap, and their crew consumed in the inferno.
The destruction you have brought upon the pirates has proven effective, and their ship explodes. You scrap the remains.
The pirate ship will no longer torment this sector. You scrap the remains.
The pirate ship has been destroyed. This action will no doubt have avenged many civilian lives.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_PIRATE_STATION
textList.text: The only good pirate is a dead pirate, and today you've made a lot of those.
The pirate station has been reduced to scrap, and their crew consumed in the inferno.
The destruction you have brought upon the pirates has proven effective, and their station explodes. You scrap the remains.
The pirate station will no longer torment this sector. You scrap the remains.

event.text: The extra fuel is always helpful, and you collect as much as you can.

textList.text: The only good pirate is a dead pirate, and today you've made a lot of those.
You've slaughtered the entirety of the pirate crew. All that's left is to scrap their ship.
You've proven yourself an efficient murderer of pirates. Their ship is yours to salvage.
The pirate ship will no longer torment this sector. You scrap the remains.

textList.text: The only good pirate is a dead pirate, and today you've made a lot of those.
You've slaughtered the entirety of the pirate crew. All that's left is to scrap their property - if it ever was theirs.
You've proven yourself an efficient murderer of pirates. Their station is yours to salvage.
The pirate lair will no longer torment this sector. You scrap the remains.

event.name: ESCAPE_PIRATE
event.text: Scans show that the pirate ship is trying to escape. Destroy it before it can get away!

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_PIRATE
textList.text: The pirate has slipped from your grasp, abandoning you at the beacon.
Your attempts at destroying the pirate have failed, and the ship has escaped.

event.name: GOTAWAY_PIRATE_REMAINS
event.text: The pirate may have escaped, but not everything has gone wrong. A trail of scrap from the wreckage has been left behind, which you collect.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_PIRATE
textList.text: "Alright, you win! Here's some equipment from our stores. Leave us alone!"
The ship repeatedly hails you. It looks like they want to surrender.
"You are considerably more well-armed than I would have thought. We surrender."
They send you a message: "Your ship is surprisingly well equipped! Please take this and let us live."
"Please don't kill us. We will give you everything we have!"
They offer you some of their cargo if you let them live.
They offer to give you some of their goods if you don't destroy their ship.
You get a frantic message, "Take everything we have. Just don't kill us!"
"You have clearly bested us. We merely request our lives."
"You have made your point, we are beaten. Take these and leave us to our shame."
"Take everything we have and let's both forget this happened."

event.text: It appears the slaves did not survive the fighting. You find their burnt bodies in the hold, but before you strip the ship you hear faint noises in the walls. You break off a latch and a slave falls out of a hidden compartment, coughing. Once recomposed the slave offers to join your crew.
You scan the ship and detect no life signs. It appears the slaves died in the fight. You strip the ship and prepare to jump.

event.name: SLAVER_CHOICE_1
event.text: You find a number of slaves in the cargo hold. They look at you questioningly and one asks if they're to be released. You could use more crew but it won't reflect positively on you for taking slaves like this.

choice.text: Demand the Mantis joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: The Mantis seems fine with the orders, saying "On board if means we get kill some Fleshbags!" You drop the rest off at a nearby station.

choice.text: Demand the Rockman joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: The Rockman remains silent and you worry there might be trouble. However when you ask him to perform a task he acts without complaint. Perhaps he won't be a problem.

choice.text: Demand the Engi joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: "Verify primary object is to defeat Rebels, re-establish peace?" You nod and it responds, "Acceptable." You drop the rest off at a nearby station and strip the ship.

choice.text: We aren't slavers. Free them all.

event.text: The slaves are shocked when instead of shuffling them away, you unlock their chains and set them free. Several of them break into tears and others bow down to you. "We thank you. We have nothing of worth to offer but our gratitude."

event.name: SLAVER_CHOICE_2
event.text: You find a number of slaves in the cargo hold. They look at you questioningly and one asks if they're to be released. You could use more crew but it won't reflect positively on you for taking slaves like this.

choice.text: Demand the Orchid joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: The Orchid doesn't protest to your demands. Lucky these plants are so peaceful, though it gives you a pang of guilt. Not enough to reconsider though.

choice.text: Demand the Shell joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: The Shell doesn't seem to mind their new assignment. Likely because your ship is a lot safer than the slaver's.

choice.text: Demand the Slug joins your crew but release the rest.

event.text: "Will there be an opportunity to get ssssome ssscrap?" You nod your head. "Alright, then I'm in."

event.text: You've taken care of the infested vessel. Whatever crew once populated the ship is gone, so you doubt they'll mind if you scrap the ship now.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_BROOD
textList.text: Another ship full of crazy spider-obsessed lunatics down. You salvage the remains.
You wish the Militia would pay you for each one of these ships you kill, but at least the scrap matter is enough to satisfy you.
The Brood has been causing issues for the Militia in this sector by weaponizing the spiders. It won't be much, but the death of this ship will still help retake this territory.
You can't imagine it's a very prideful death dying amongst the corpses of dozens of spiders, but they chose the life of a pirate and you chose the life of killing them.
Another Brood vessel has met its untimely end at your hand. You give the orders to start the salvage operation.

event.text: The extra fuel is always helpful, and you collect as much as you can.
