textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_HACKER
textList.text: Another pestilent hacker ship has been destroyed. Their spoils are yours.
The bounty of the destroyed hacker ship is yours for the taking.
The hacker ship and its crew are no more. The scrap is yours.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_HACKER
textList.text: Your slaughter of the hackers has proven very effective. If war crimes weren't a thing, it would be something you could brag about.
Another shipload of filthy hackers has proven inferior to you. Their ship is yours.
The hacker ship has been emptied of life signs. That'll show them who's boss.
No more lifeforms are detected on the hacker vessel.

event.text: Your computer freaks out, a stream of encoded messages and meaningless text flash on the screen. The hacker must have deployed an emergency virus! You quarantine your systems to prevent the spread just in time, but the cascading effects will likely continue even as the Rebels pass through. That should cause them some trouble.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_HACKER
textList.text: "Ahh, what an excellent fighter you have proven. How much ssscrap will it take to make you forget thisss ever happened?"
"Ok, you've made quite the messss over here. Will thisss assssuage your bloodlussst?"
The hackers desperately call for a ceasefire.
"Captain, perhapsss we are all being too hasssty. We don't want to go down thisss path, do we? We can be forgiving, and we hope you are too. Will thisss be enough to turn your back?"

event.text: You collect the supplies, but notice a disturbance in your power levels. The hackers tricked you!

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_MANTIS
textList.text: The hull of the Mantis Ship no longer looks so threatening now that it has been destroyed. You scrap the remains.
You know that without ever knowing their names, you have just avenged hundreds of innocent people by destroying this ship.
The Mantis ship is no more, except as scrap for you to take.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_MANTIS
textList.text: The Mantis threat aboard the ship has been exterminated. Pleased with your work, you treat yourself to the remains of their ship.
The corpses of the Mantis crew litter the halls, and the stench of pheromones hangs in the air. You try not to breathe as you scrap the ship.
Despite the Mantis being fearsome warriors, they were no match for your ship.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_MANTIS_SLAVE
event.text: You move on to scrap the empty Mantis ship. However as you scrap the remains, you hear a clanging from the cargo bay.
You ignore the clanging noise, and finish up scrapping the hull. Just to be sure, you turn off the oxygen on your way out.
You open the cargo bay to find an Engi slave. Now freed, they give you their equivalent of a thank you. You offer them a place on your ship, which they accept.
You open the cargo bay to find a Mantis survivor, who attacks you in rage! The intruder is subdued, but left some damage.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: The hull of the Free Mantis ship rends and buckles as it is torn apart. As you scrap their ship, you reflect that this relatively young faction is not ready for what it takes to be at war.

As awful as it feels, sometimes there's no good option. Destroying a ship full of supposed allies isn't something you're proud of - but your mission comes first, and there was no other choice. You prepare to scrap the ship.
Considering how most Free Mantis want to join the Federation, something feels off about destroying one of their vessels. Hopefully the Warlords will understand what you had to do.
You wonder, if the Free Mantis here knew the importance of the mission, would there even have been a fight? Their scrap is still useful, all the same.
Some day, the Free Mantis may join the Federation. Hopefully they will not hold this incident against you when they do.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: Whether it had to be this way or not, circumstances led you to eliminating the Free Mantis crew. You might as well scrap their ship and make sure your mission is a success in the meantime.

It's easy to feel guilty when all you're left with is corpses, but you know you didn't have any choice. You regret the loss of life, but not what you've done. The scrap from stripping the ship doesn't hurt either.
The Free Mantis put up a bloody fight, even against their desired allies. However, it was a fight you were more than capable of winning.
Although the aftermath of a Free Mantis fight is much like a Hive Mantis fight, it feels different to scrap a ship that could have, under different circumstances, been friendly.
The stench of synthetic pheromones linger as you scrap the derelict Free Mantis ship. Hopefully you won't have to fight many more of these.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: The Free Mantis captain limps into the range of the camera. "We don't understand. Federation supposed to be good persons..."
Mantis don't usually show weakness in combat, but the Free Mantis ship is asking if you will accept their surrender.
"We thought Free Mantis and Federation allies. Kill us, and you are breaking trust."
The Free Mantis seem less willing to fight. Their captain hails you, offering to call a ceasefire.
"Our clan surely exile us for cowardice, but please, let us live."
The battered ship contacts you out of desperation. The captain reminds you of their truce with the Federation, requesting you to call off your attack.
The Free Mantis ship tries desperately to contact you. You suspect they're trying to surrender.
"Ok, we raise the flag of white. Let us live, we beg."
The Free Mantis ship repeatedly attempts to hail you. You open up your comms only to be greeted with panicked proposals of surrender for resources, with the crackling of fire mixed in.
You hear the Free Mantis captain scrambling as he hails you. "Alright, alright!" He offers a selection of resources in exchange for his ship's survival.
The Free Mantis ship hails you. "We beg mercy. It is not Mantis custom to forgive, but we hope it is for you."

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ROCK
textList.text: By destroying this ship, you have indeed proven yourself a threat to the Rockmen's ways.
The Rockmen may not be sworn enemies of the Federation, but you still feel no guilt about destroying this ship. Mostly.
At last, the armor of the Rock ship gives out, and a mighty explosion tears the ship apart.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_ROCK
textList.text: The interior of the Rock ship is littered with small stones. You all know where they came from, but no one dares comment on it as you salvage the ship.
You've successfully killed the Rock crew, and their scrap is left as yours for the taking.
You can't imagine it looks good on the Federation when you keep removing Rock ships like this, but at this point you're past caring.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_ROCK_GENERIC
textList.text: The Rock ship hails: "Enough! We were told aliens were a threat to our ways, and you have proved as much. Take this and leave us in peace."
Their systems suffering, the Rock ship attempts to make contact: "Alien vessel. Cease your attack. We will pay."
The Rock ship moves into a defensive position and transmits a white flag signal. They seem willing to buy their lives.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ROCK_STATION
textList.text: By destroying this station, you have indeed proven yourself a threat to the Rockmen's ways.
The Rockmen may not be sworn enemies of the Federation, but you still feel no guilt about destroying their infrastructure. Mostly.
At last, the armor of the Rock station gives out, and a mighty explosion tears the structure apart.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_ROCK_STATION
textList.text: The interior of the Rock station is littered with small stones. You all know where they came from, but no one dares comment on it as you salvage your spoils.
You've successfully killed the Rock crew, and their scrap is left as yours for the taking.
You can't imagine it looks good on the Federation when you confront Rockmen in such manner, but at this point you're past caring.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_ROCK_STATION
textList.text: The Rock station hails: "Enough! We were told aliens were a threat to our ways, and you have proved as much. Take this and leave us in peace."
Their systems suffering, the Rock station attempts to make contact: "Alien vessel. Cease your attack. We will pay."
The Rock station, realising it has been outgunned, transmits a white flag signal. They seem willing to buy their lives.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_OUTCAST
textList.text: Outcasts aren't quite the same threat as your ordinary pirates, but that doesn't mean they weren't a threat. Probably.

Exploring the wreckage reveals various colorful murals painted on the walls of the hull. Some are quite touching, but others depict violent and brutal murder. Maybe it's a good thing these guys are dead now.
As the outcasts live their final moments, you receive one last message. "At least... this is better than the coal mines..."

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_OUTCAST
textList.text: Outcasts aren't quite the same threat as your ordinary pirates, but that doesn't mean they weren't a threat. Probably.

Exploring the wreckage reveals various colorful murals painted on the walls of the hull. Some are quite touching, but others depict violent and brutal murder. Maybe it's a good thing these guys are dead now.
As the outcasts live their final moments, you receive one last message. "At least... this is better than the coal mines..."

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_OUTCAST_GENERIC
textList.text: "Hah! What a riot - we were told the Federation fought to protect the galaxy from oppression. Not only have you turned your back to the Theocracy, but you've committed to annihilating our people! Prove you know mercy and let us go."
"The Theocracy has told many lies - but they were telling the truth when they told us Renegades made dangerous foes! You win, accept this surrender and let us live!"
"Our greatest mistake was to match you here - but please! Let us live on to learn from this mistake. We outcasts have only just tasted freedom, it would be a shame to die so soon."
It appears the crew of the Outcast ship have hastily painted themselves white, desperately trying to convey their sudden declaration of surrender. Will you accept?

event.name: SURRENDER_OUTCAST_CREW
event.text: "No more! We yield. Please, take this one. He smells awful and contributes nothing. He will be more of use on your ship than on ours."

event.name: DESTROYED_LOSTSUN
event.text: If you continue to destroy Lost Sun ships, the shaky alliance they hold with the Federation will not last for long. At least you get some scrap out of it.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_LOSTSUN
event.text: If you continue to kill Lost Sun followers, the shaky alliance they hold with the Federation will not last for long. At least you get some scrap out of it.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_SLUG
textList.text: For all the Slugs' efforts, they were not able to defeat you. The victor of this battle, you indulge yourself by scrapping their ship.
The Slug ship is no more. You scrap the wreckage.
At last, the traitorous nebula-dwellers have been silenced. You scrap the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_SLUG
textList.text: You find the gasping corpse of the Slug Captain quivering on the ground. He utters one last word, "Sssshit", then collapses and dies.
You feel no remorse for the Slug crew, though you do wish their ship smelled better.
The interior of the ship is now coated in what appears to be a mixture of slime and mashed up Slug intestines. Yuck.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_SLUG_GENERIC
textList.text: The Slug captain hails you. "Oh, your highnessss, you are ssso brave and truly the greatessst warrior to have ever lived. Will you ssspare ussssss, so that we may sssshare your tale?"
"Ok, I ssssee no reassson to lie right now. We're kinda ssssscrewed unlesssss you let usss go. We'll give you sssome junk if you agree."
Slugs are known for their cowardice, and as expected the Slug ship here has given up and surrendered.
"Dear godsss, I did not expect thisss! I applaud you for the sssuprissse. Now let ussss go."

event.text: Suddenly, just as you are about to leave, the Slug ship reactivates its weapons and fires a shot off! It doesn't get past your defenses, but the cargo crate they gave you explodes in an ion blast which partially disables your shields.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_CLAN
textList.text: The proud Clansmen and their ship have been destroyed. Though their many trophies have been purged along with them, at least you can salvage the scrap from their ship.
The Guild probably won't appreciate you killing off their members, but what are they going to do about it? You scrap the ship.
You've no doubt avenged the souls of many innocent lives who were hunted down by these Clansmen. Plus, you get some scrap out of it.

While the ship explodes, you try to think of a clever bit of wordplay to describe the situation. You decide to go with "The hunters become the hunted" before you snap out of it and give orders to scrap the wreckage.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_CLAN
textList.text: The captain of the Slug vessel coughs as he bleeds out on the floor. He looks you in the eyes one last time, mouths the words "Damn you", and dies.
You've taken out the crew of the Slug vessel. These Clansmen might make good fighters, but they didn't stand a chance against you.
The Guild probably won't appreciate you killing off their members, but what are they going to do about it? You scrap the ship.
You try to think of a clever bit of word play to describe the situation. You decide to go with "The hunters become the hunted" before you snap out of it and give orders to scrap the wreckage.

event.text: As you inspect the interior of the vessel, you find a small trophy room containing the corpses of several alien creatures. Further inspection leads you to a prison hold, where one living prisoner remains.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_CLAN_GENERIC
textList.text: "We will never ssssurrender!" Shouts the Clansman, right as your shot scatters across their hull. "Uhhhh, ssscratch that. How much for you to let ussss go?"
It appears the Clansmen have given up. "Agggh, ssstop! Take all this sssscrap, let ussss go!"
You spot an alert on your computer screen. Upon opening it, you're greeted by a video feed of the Clansmen waving literal white flags towards the camera.

event.text: Suddenly, just as you are about to leave, the Slug ship reactivates its weapons and fires a shot off! It doesn't get past your defenses, but the cargo crate they gave you explodes in an ion blast which partially disables your shields.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_HEKTAR
textList.text: As the Hektar ship breaks apart, you can't help but wonder if their ships were designed to be as easy to put together as their weapons.

The Hektar ship explodes, and an automatic message is sent out to your ship. "Hektar Industries applauds you for your success in combat. Before you can scrap our ship however, we request you watch this short ad..."

A plethora of boxes come flying out of the cargo bay of the other ship. You consider grabbing some, but the pictures on the side suggest they aren't worth your time. What is two circles and an oval even supposed to mean?
You receive one last hail from the Hektar Captain as his ship is plunged into flames. "I wasssn't paid enough to sssay sssomething clever. But if my manager assksss, pretend I did-"

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_HEKTAR
textList.text: "God... damn... it... I didn't even get thisss week'sss pay check yet..."
In his final moments, the Slug captain shrugs. "Better then having to go back to the call center I guesssss."
"Gaahhhh, sssso much for that healthcare..." The Slug slumps over dead and you scrap his ship.
As you walk amongst the corpses of the Slugs, you catch the final words of one last survivor; "Bury me with my money..." Unfortunately for him, you have other plans on what to do with it.

event.text: Just before you finish scrapping the ship, you find a hidden storage compartment. Inside is a weapon module, for use with Hektar weaponry.
Just before you finish scrapping the ship, you find a hidden storage compartment. Inside is fresh Hektar weapon, without any modules installed.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_HEKTAR_GENERIC
textList.text: "You know what? Thissss job wassssn't worth it anywayssss. I am formally resssigning. You wouldn't kill an innocent unemployed civilian now, would you?"
"Capitalissssm hasss failed me! I ssshall forever now be communissst. Bribery and communisssm are sssynonymousss, right?"
"Who'sss paying you for thisss? I refusssse to believe you aren't in thisss for money. Well guesss what! I have money too!"
The Hektar employee frantically flips through his employee manual. "Crap, it doesssn't sssay anything about what to do here! Uh, time to resssort to plan B. Buy my way out!"

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_LEECH
textList.text: Sound does not travel through space, so you are only left to wonder what sound the Leech ship's crew made as they're blown to smitherenes.
Moments before the Leech ship is destroyed, you feel as if the ship's residents have made one final, potent sigh as they accept their fate.
If the legends of the once great Leech military were ever true, they certainly don't hold up today. For your sake, let's hope they never make a resurgence.
If you keep destroying Leech ships, maybe they'll give up and leave you alone for good. It's probably too much to hope for, but it's not impossible either.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_LEECH
textList.text: The scene left from the massacre here is far from a pretty one. The diced up bits of Leech flesh let off a repugnant odor so foul you almost consider leaving the wreck behind entirely. Almost.
You've heard the disturbing stories of the haunting post-mortem smiles of Leech crew. However, it would seem that those stories are mere legends, as their faces look roughly how you'd expect.
You experience no further resistance as you scrap their ship. There's a lingering feeling that there may be a survivor hidden onboard, but they do not stop you from taking whatever salvage you find.

Walking among the corpses of these parasites is nothing short of eerie. Their wide gaping mouths seem as if they could reach out at any moment and strike you. You keep your hand near your blaster at all times as you scrap the ship.

Apparently, shortly after death, the corpse of a Leech will drain itself slowly of all the built up electricity it has stored over its life. With this many bodies, it could be catastrophic in close quarters. You make sure to hurry and scrap the ship before you can get caught in a mine field of electrified bodies.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_LEECH_GENERIC
textList.text: "Oooh, woe is me. The end of days is upon us! Why do we even try..." The Leech ship hopes you'll take pity on them.
The Leech captain regurgitates several mounds of white cloth. You're disgusted and confused for a few moments until you realize this is a convoluted attempt to "raise the white flag".
You aren't surprised the Leech captain appears to have given up so easily. They aren't exactly known for their loyalty or commitment. The question is, will you spare them?

The Leech captain burps loudly, specks of bile landing on their camera. Repulsive, but according to your captain's handbook this is one of the many ways the Leeches will offer their surrender to enemy captains.
"We will never surrender! Eargen forever- aaaaactually, nevermind. We surrender. I don't want to die."
The enemy's captain appears to be waving frantically with his tongue "hands". Looks like he's trying to get your attention to surrender.

event.name: SURRENDER_LEECH_GIVEUP
event.text: From out of nowhere, the Leech ship simply powers off its weapons and shields. They aren't out of the fight yet, but it seems as though... they want you to kill them?

choice.text: Fulfill their wish and end this fight.

event.text: The Leech ship slinks away like a wounded animal without another word.
The Leeches seem surprised but grateful and timidly offer a bit of their cargo.
Looks like the Leeches won't be spared that easily. They continue to press on, even reactivating their weapons just to keep you in the fight.
The Leeches are surprised but grateful. One wounded soldier offers himself up to work aboard your ship, likely as an escape from his services to the Republic.

event.name: ESCAPE_LEECH
event.text: It appears the Leech ship has reconsidered staying around to finish this fight. They're trying to escape!

event.name: GOTAWAY_LEECH_GENERIC
event.text: The Leech ship jumps away, leaving you behind at the beacon.

event.name: GOTAWAY_LEECH_REMAINS
event.text: The Leech ship jumps away. At first you're disappointed, but then you realise a portion of scrap matter has been left behind from the fight. It's not much, but it helps soften the blow of your failure.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_SHELL
textList.text: The Shell ship explodes, sending clouds of poisonous gas out into space. Hopefully there are no stations with open airlocks nearby...
Despite all their defensive measures, the Shell ship has been defeated. You scrap the remains.
The Shells are known for their well-maintained defenses, but your weaponry has proven effective once again.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_SHELL
textList.text: Fighting Shells is dangerous considering how well protected they are, but you've cleared the ship of crew. Their scrap is yours.
The Shell ship has been neutralized. You scrap the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_SHELL
textList.text: "Please, you are too strong! We do not want to fight! Let us live!"
Unlike their Slug cousins, Shells aren't very greedy. They'd much rather pay some scrap instead of dying. Will you accept their offer?
You receive a hail from the Shell captain. "Yes yes, your guns are very good. Let us go, we have scrap!"

event.name: ESCAPE_SHELL
event.text: It appears the Shell ship has reconsidered staying around to finish this fight. They're trying to escape!

event.name: GOTAWAY_SHELL_GENERIC
event.text: The Shell ship jumps away, leaving you behind at the beacon.

event.name: GOTAWAY_SHELL_REMAINS
event.text: The Shell ship jumps away. At first you're disappointed, but then you realise a portion of scrap matter has been left behind from the fight. It's not much, but it helps soften the blow of your failure.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_MORPH
textList.text: The grey vessel is engulfed in an orange glow, its bland hull going up in flames that are quickly extinguished by the vacuum of space.

The likely fact you just blew up, not only a crew of many Morphs, but one massive Morph as well is a weird one to grasp. You wonder if the scrap metal from the wreckage will Morph back into enemies, or stay lifeless.

You wonder if the Morphs felt pain as their ship just imploded. You hope not, but only because you can never be sure if these things are really dead, and you'd hate for them to come back to haunt you later.
Another mysterious ship full of Morphs down. You salvage the wreckage.

event.name: DESTROYED_MORPH_EXTRA
event.text: You scrap the wreck of the Morph ship, but notice a bit of debris floating nearby.
Looks like the salvage was as you expected. You scoop it up and bring it aboard the ship.
Your crew bring aboard the salvage, noting how light it is. Once aboard, the scrap suddenly changes shape, turning into a band of angry Morphs who attack!

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_MORPH
textList.text: The gibberish spewing blobs have been brought to an untimely end. You scrap their ship.
The concept that your crew are now standing inside a giant Morph itself while scrapping the ship is somewhat unsettling, but you bury your concerns and order your crew to hurry up.
The grey stains of once sentient goop mark the walls of the ship, scattered about during the fight. You can only hope they won't animate once again and attack you while salvaging.
As you scrap the Morph ship, you wonder if those strange gray blobs can feel pain, and if their final moments were in agony. Honestly, you still aren't sure if they're sapient.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_MORPH
textList.text: "Kip kip joo! Urg la yoo purl yu!" You think the Morphs are surrendering, but you aren't sure. How do you respond?
"Oj joo! Oj joo! Yur kip looloo!" You think the Morphs are surrendering, but you aren't sure. How do you respond?
"Odle yup. Kim jio kup kurp!" You think the Morphs are surrendering, but you aren't sure. How do you respond?

event.text: You disarm the weapons, hoping the Morphs will do the same. They do in fact turn their weapons offline as well, though whether they're doing that because you understood correctly or they think you're surrendering instead is up to debate. Not long after, a small Morph finds its way onto the ship, but they seem friendly and want to stay.
You disarm the weapons, hoping the Morphs will do the same. Instead, a group of angry blobs bust their way into your ship and the fight continues!

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_COALITION
textList.text: The Coalition ship explodes. As the separate pieces float away, you can once again see the divide between the factions. You like it better this way.
The Coalition doesn't mess around, but yet again you've come out on top. The remains of their ship are yours to scrap.
You've proven that no one, Rebel or Coalition, can outmatch you. Or at least, this ship couldn't.
The Coalition vessel is blasted apart from your assault. With the destruction of this ship, humans can hopefully rest a little easier.
The enemy ship crumbles into its constituent pieces. The combined ingenuity of the Federation's enemies fortunately results in a ship that is quite profitable to scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_COALITION
textList.text: A mixture of all different kinds of alien blood is on your hands. No wonder they must all hate the Federation.
The Coalition is made of some of the most fearsome warrior races, but your crew has proven themselves superior.
A cornucopia of Coalition corpses cover the floor. There's nothing to stop you from harvesting their vessel and venturing forth.
The Coalition has been known to boast their physical strength in comparison to the Federation, but your crew was more than equipped to prove that they are not to be trifled with.
Both the Federation and Coalition believe that diversity is strength. As their ship is the one that's devoid of life, you've proven that yours is stronger.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_COALITION
textList.text: The captain of the Coalition ship hails you, and begrudgingly requests that you accept their surrender.
You can tell it's hard for the Coalition captain to admit, but they have been bested. They offer a surrender.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_GHOST
textList.text: It is hard to draw the line between the original state of disrepair the vessel was in and the destruction you have caused. You add to the damage even further by scrapping the ship.
The Ghost ship is no more. You scrap what you can.
The circle of life for this ship has been complete. Now finally destroyed, as it should have been originally, you scrap what remains.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_GHOST
textList.text: You have emptied the ship of its ghostly captors. No longer shall they prey on innocent ships passing through this sector.
It dawns on you that twice now the entire crew of this ship has been exterminated. The thought chills you as you scrap it.
Now empty of crew, you make sure to thoroughly scrap the ruins so that no more Ghosts can ever inhabit this ship.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_DYNASTY
textList.text: The Dynasty's architects probably cringe every time they catch news another one of their ships have been destroyed. Their fleets have been reduced ever since the great cataclysm of their past, and you certainly aren't helping.
The vibrant blue lights on the Dynasty vessel flicker in their final moments before the brilliant blue glow ceases and the integrity of the ship's hull crumbles.

If every Federation ship removed Dynasty vessels with the same level of efficiency as you, it would be no wonder that they hate you all! However, from your experience, it doesn't seem there are many competent captains out there to explain the phenomenon.

You catch a glimpse of glittering wisps of color floating out of the hull as it collapses. Have the Ghosts escaped their horrible fate, or is this merely the equivalent of a corpse being flung out into the cosmos? You really aren't sure.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_DYNASTY
textList.text: You've heard that the Ghosts have a most horrible odour to them, and you couldn't be more glad there's no air inside the Dynasty ship to carry the scent as you scrap it.
You wonder if Ghosts feel pain before they die. After what just happened here, you sincerely hope they don't.
"Arg, see to it that you are penetrated up the rectum, you foul wretch," mutters the Ghost captain as he begins to dissipate.

You remember a time on your MV Traveler handbook that recommended to not bother with the effort of killing Ghosts while preserving their vessel. But look at you now! If only the people back at Universe 0 could see the havoc you caused.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_LANIUS
textList.text: One can never be too cautious while scrapping a Lanius ship, for fear of either a lone survivor drifting in the vacuum or a collision with the sharp debris.
The destruction of the Lanius vessel provides you with great satisfaction, knowing how infamously difficult the Lanius are as foes.
The Lanius may be excellent scavengers, but today you've turned the tables on them.

event.text: It seems the destruction of the Lanius ship was not enough to kill off all of its crew. A single Lanius managed to escape the inferno and has now attached itself to the ship!

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_LANIUS
textList.text: It's difficult to scrap the oxygenless interiors of the Lanius ship, but you can manage. Nothing will keep you from your precious scrap, not even the cruel vacuum of space.

Without crew on board to disturb you, you can truly appreciate the intricacies of Lanius architecture. Sure, it looks like a bunch of kitchen knives duct-taped together, but anything can be art with the right attitude.
With the crew of the Lanius ship dead, nothing prevents you from tearing apart the hull of their ship.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_LANIUS
textList.text: An image of a silent Lanius captain appears on your monitor. Images of their well-filled cargo hold follow. You come to the conclusion that they are trying to barter for a cease-fire.
The Lanius ship hails you. Your translator struggles, spurting out "Prevent death... Merciful... Penitent...". You believe they are surrendering.
You receive a hail from the ship followed by a crude translation device spurting, "Stop. Stop. Stop."
You receive an image of their captain, silhouetted by the destruction aboard their ship. It bows forward with the metallic appendages about its body doing the same. It appears to be requesting mercy.
Your comms system receives a video feed of the enemy ship's crew waving small makeshift white flags. It appears they have taken research about your culture's customs quite literally.
You receive a message from the enemy ship that your translator struggles to interpret, "Penitence for metal. Offering intention."
You receive a one word message from the enemy ship, "Surrender." You assume they are asking to surrender rather than demanding your surrender.

event.name: DESTROYED_SIREN_UNKNOWN
event.text: The mysterious vessel is destroyed. You scrap its smooth white hull while the rainbow lights continue to flicker in and out of life.

event.name: DEADCREW_SIREN_UNKNOWN
event.text: The crew of the mysterious vessel is dead. You scrap its smooth white hull while the rainbow lights continue to flicker in and out of life.

To your surprise, you find another person stuffed into the storage of the alien ship. They appear to be under some strange trance that has now begun to slowly wear off. Once they're safe, they agree to join your crew.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_AUGMENTED
textList.text: One can never be too cautious while scrapping a Lanius ship, for fear of either a lone survivor drifting in the vacuum or a collision with the sharp debris.
The destruction of the Lanius vessel provides you with great satisfaction, knowing how infamously difficult the Lanius are as foes.
The Lanius may be excellent scavengers, but today you've turned the tables on them.

event.text: It seems the destruction of the Lanius ship was not enough to kill off all of its crew. A single Lanius managed to escape the inferno and has now attached itself to the ship!

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_AUGMENTED
textList.text: It's difficult to scrap the oxygenless interiors of the Lanius ship, but you can manage. Nothing will keep you from your precious scrap, not even the cruel vacuum of space.

Without crew on board to disturb you, you can truly appreciate the intricacies of Lanius architecture. Sure, it looks like a bunch of kitchen knives duct-taped together, but anything can be art with the right attitude.
With the crew of the Lanius ship dead, nothing prevents you from tearing apart the hull of their ship.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_ANCIENT
textList.text: You have rid the galaxy of another Obelisk ship. There's bound to be hundreds more, but it's something.
The Obelisk ship explodes into many smaller pieces, its cubical shape shattered forever. It's oddly satisfying, and you reflect fondly on your handiwork as you scrap the remains.
Though you know the Obelisks are the antagonists of this galaxy, you can't help but wonder if every ship you kill was aware of their grand scheme.
With every Obelisk ship you destroy, you delay the date of the invasion just a little bit more. You know it's not much, but it feels important to you.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_ANCIENT
textList.text: As the last Obelisk collapses, it lets out two last words. "Screw... you..."
You've made quick work of these cubical aliens. You don't feel the pang of guilt that usually accompanies these murders - for the most part.
The interior of the Obelisk ship is littered with the dust of the fallen crew. You call it a job well done and give the orders to scrap the ship.
The death of the Obelisk ship and its crew means good news for the rest of the galaxy. You just hope they don't have any families to grieve them.

event.name: DEFEAT_REBEL_ELITE
event.text: You've defeated the Rebel Elite, which is no easy task. It's not enough to impact the fleet, but it's still a great victory.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Rebel ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_AUTO_ELITE
event.text: You've defeated the Innovation Auto-ship. The escalation in threat posed by this foe could not be denied, but in the end, it was still nothing more than an infernal machine promptly silenced by your show of force.
It seems the cargo of the advanced Auto-ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_ENGINEER_ELITE
event.text: You've defeated a technician vessel, impressive. Though they may simply be menial workers in the eyes of Wentworth Innovations, their ships are considerably well armed, and successfully defeating one in combat is no small feat.
It seems the cargo of the Technician ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_FED_ELITE
event.text: Eliminating allied Federation personnel, especially Elite ones, is highly contrary to your mission, but that doesn't mean you're beyond salvaging the remains.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Federation ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_STEALTH
event.text: The Federation has precious few stealth ships in service, and eliminating one is a major blow to their special operations. But your mission is more important, and you waste little time in salvaging the remains.
It seems the cargo of the stealth ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_ENGI_ELITE
event.text: With the death of the Engi Defenders there are now fewer ships to protect the Harmony from true threats, but you can't run away from every fight. You salvage the remains of the ship.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Engi ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional drone, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_ZOLTAN_ELITE
event.text: So much for peacekeeping. The Ministry struggles to keep its peacekeeper task force up to par with all of the disorder in the Multiverse, and this certainly won't help that.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Zoltan ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_MILITIA_ELITE
event.text: The EDC is one of the few forces capable of defending civilian sectors, and they aren't exactly common. The loss of this ship will certainly have negative results on the Militia.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Militia ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_ORCHID_ELITE
event.text: You've managed to take down a Praetor and their ship, and now the remains are yours to scrap.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Orchid ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_VAMPWEED_ELITE
event.text: You've managed to take down a Cultivator and their ship, and now the remains are yours to scrap.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Vampweed ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_CRYSTAL_ELITE
event.text: The bright red shards of the Sentinel vessel fly off into the abyss as the mighty elite vessel comes to a halt.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Crystal ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_ROCK_ELITE
event.text: The Inquisition was once one of the most feared forces in the entire galaxy, but they've fallen from glory. This victory only adds insult to injury.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Rock ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DESTROY_FREEMAN_ELITE
event.text: The Warlord ship has been destroyed. You scrap what is left over from the wreckage.

event.name: DEADCREW_FREEMAN_ELITE
event.text: The Warlord ship has been neutralized. You scrap what is left over from the ship.

It appears one of the Warlords managed to survive the conflict, though injured. It seems they're healthy enough to shamble out of their hiding spot to meet you. "Oh noble Federation, you are glorious fighter! Bring me mercy, and allow me to serve you!"

event.name: DEFEAT_SUZERAIN_ELITE
event.text: You've managed to take down a powerful Hive Elite and their ship, and now the remains are yours to scrap.
It seems the cargo of the Mantis Elite ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_DUSK_ELITE
event.text: Today you've shown the Duskbringers you don't mess around. No vessel, not even the most extreme, can defeat you.
It seems the cargo of the Duskbringer ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_SLUG_ELITE
event.text: If the original Clairvoyants of centuries ago could see their descendants now, falling to a ship like yours, they'd weep. Which, frankly, you don't mind.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Slug ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_SHELL_ELITE
event.text: A Radiant vessel has fallen to your ship. It might make Shell space less safe in the long run, but for now it means you'll live to see another day.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Shell ship survived the fight. Inside is an Anti-Hull weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_LEECH_ELITE
event.text: The Amperes are trained explicitly by the Coalition itself, and are far deadlier than normal Leeches. By putting this ship out of commission, you've probably crippled a good percentage of the Republic's only able soldiers.
It seems the cargo of the Leech ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_COALITION_ELITE
event.text: As you watch the Coalition vessel break apart, you reflect on what a stupid acronym "R.U.E.S." is. Like seriously, who even came up with that?
It seems the cargo of the Elite Coalition ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_LANIUS_ELITE
event.text: The defeat of the Lanius Elites is nothing to scoff at, and neither is the amount of salvage left behind.
It seems the cargo of the Lanius ship survived the fight. Inside is a Flak cannon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_VAGABOND_ELITE
event.text: The erratic tactics these unstable Ghosts employ already makes them frightening foes, but when former Elite ships are thrown in the equation, the situation can easily sway unfavorably. Fortunately, you've prevailed.
It seems the cargo of the Vagabond ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional albeit rusty weapon, which you bring back on board.

event.name: DEFEAT_DYNASTY_ELITE
event.text: Reaper ships are no idle threat, but the Dynasty should know better than to throw punches at you.
It seems the cargo of the Dynasty ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional weapon, which you bring back on board.
